title: Gyrn Moelfre
text:
Gyrn Moelfre is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in <a href="Powys">Powys</a>, <a href="mid%20Wales">mid Wales</a>, near the border with <a href="Shropshire">Shropshire</a>. It stands to the south-east of the <a href="Berwyn%20range">Berwyns</a>, from which it is separated by <a href="Afon%20Ysgwennant">Afon Ysgwennant</a>. The village of <a href="Llansilin">Llansilin</a> lies on its south-west slopes. It was historically in <a href="Denbighshire">Denbighshire</a>, but the area was transferred to Powys in 1996.
In the modern era, the "Gyrn" has played host to the British Downhill Series and some other smaller events on the downhill calendar
